intro: Humboltia saurocephala, commonly known as the helmet flower, is a flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its striking, helmet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas, thriving in sandy or rocky soils. Its flowers are usually violet or purple and bloom during the dry season. Humboltia saurocephala is notable for its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
